Events.text: Fighters of the First Crusade defeat Kerbogha of Mosull.
Events.html: Fighters of the First Crusade defeat Kerbogha of Mosull.

Events.text: Muhammed VI becomes the tenth Nasrid king of Granada after killing his brother-in-law Ismail II.
Events.html: Muhammed VI becomes the tenth Nasrid king of Granada after killing his brother-in-law Ismail II.

Events.text: Edward IV is crowned King of England.
Events.html: Edward IV is crowned King of England.

Events.text: Charles V is elected Emperor of the Holy Roman Empire.
Events.html: Charles V is elected Emperor of the Holy Roman Empire.

Events.text: Guadeloupe becomes a French colony.
Events.html: Guadeloupe becomes a French colony.

Events.text: The Battle of Berestechko between Poland and Ukraine starts.
Events.html: The Battle of Berestechko between Poland and Ukraine starts.

Events.text: Peter the Great defeats Charles XII of Sweden at the Battle of Poltava
Events.html: Peter the Great defeats Charles XII of Sweden at the Battle of Poltava

Events.text: A New England colonial army captures the French fortifications at Louisbourg (New Style).
Events.html: A New England colonial army captures the French fortifications at Louisbourg (New Style).

Events.text: The Battle of Sullivan's Island ends with the American victory in the American Revolutionary War leading to the commemoration of Carolina Day.
Events.html: The Battle of Sullivan's Island ends with the American victory in the American Revolutionary War leading to the commemoration of Carolina Day.

Events.text: Thomas Hickey, Continental Army private and bodyguard to General George Washington, is hanged for mutiny and sedition.
Events.html: 1776 – Thomas Hickey, Continental Army private and bodyguard to General George Washington, is hanged for mutiny and sedition.

Events.text: The American Continentals engage the British in the Battle of Monmouth Courthouse resulting in standstill and British withdrawal under cover of darkness.
Events.html: The American Continentals engage the British in the Battle of Monmouth Courthouse resulting in standstill and British withdrawal under cover of darkness.

Events.text: Second British invasion of the Río de la Plata; John Whitelocke lands at Ensenada on an attempt to recapture Buenos Aires and is defeated by the locals.
Events.html: Second British invasion of the Río de la Plata; John Whitelocke lands at Ensenada on an attempt to recapture Buenos Aires and is defeated by the locals.

links.title: British invasions of the River Plate

Events.text: Coronation of Queen Victoria of the United Kingdom.
Events.html: Coronation of Queen Victoria of the United Kingdom.

Events.text: The Paris Opera Ballet premieres Giselle in the Salle Le Peletier
Events.html: The Paris Opera Ballet premieres Giselle in the Salle Le Peletier

Events.text: Adolphe Sax patents the saxophone
Events.html: Adolphe Sax patents the saxophone

Events.text: Sigma Chi fraternity is founded in North America.
Events.html: Sigma Chi fraternity is founded in North America.

links.title: Fraternities and sororities in North America

Events.text: The first conformation dog show is held in Newcastle upon Tyne, England.
Events.html: The first conformation dog show is held in Newcastle upon Tyne, England.

Events.text: The Army of the Potomac is disbanded.
Events.html: The Army of the Potomac is disbanded.

Events.text: The Australian bushranger Ned Kelly is captured at Glenrowan.
Events.html: The Australian bushranger Ned Kelly is captured at Glenrowan.

Events.text: The Austro–Serbian Alliance of 1881 is secretly signed.
Events.html: The Austro–Serbian Alliance of 1881 is secretly signed.

Events.text: The Anglo-French Convention of 1882 marks the territorial boundaries between Guinea and Sierra Leone.
Events.html: The Anglo-French Convention of 1882 marks the territorial boundaries between Guinea and Sierra Leone.

Events.text: Labor Day becomes an official US holiday.
Events.html: Labor Day becomes an official US holiday.

Events.text: El Salvador, Honduras and Nicaragua form the Greater Republic of Central America.
Events.html: El Salvador, Honduras and Nicaragua form the Greater Republic of Central America.

Events.text: The United States Court of Private Land Claims rules James Reavis' claim to Barony of Arizona is "wholly fictitious and fraudulent."
Events.html: 1895 – The United States Court of Private Land Claims rules James Reavis' claim to Barony of Arizona is "wholly fictitious and fraudulent."

links.title: United States Court of Private Land Claims

Events.text: An explosion in the Newton Coal Company's Twin Shaft Mine in Pittston, Pennsylvania results in a massive cave-in that kills 58 miners.
Events.html: An explosion in the Newton Coal Company's Twin Shaft Mine in Pittston, Pennsylvania results in a massive cave-in that kills 58 miners.

Events.text: The U.S. Congress passes the Spooner Act, authorizing President Theodore Roosevelt to acquire rights from Colombia for the Panama Canal.
Events.html: The U.S. Congress passes the Spooner Act, authorizing President Theodore Roosevelt to acquire rights from Colombia for the Panama Canal.

Events.text: The SS Norge runs aground and sinks
Events.html: The SS Norge runs aground and sinks

Events.text: Archduke Franz Ferdinand of Austria and his wife Sophie are assassinated in Sarajevo; this is the casus belli of World War I.
Events.html: Archduke Franz Ferdinand of Austria and his wife Sophie are assassinated in Sarajevo; this is the casus belli of World War I.

links.title: Assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand of Austria

Events.text: The Treaty of Versailles is signed, ending the state of war between Germany and the Allies of World War I.
Events.html: The Treaty of Versailles is signed, ending the state of war between Germany and the Allies of World War I.

Events.text: Serbian King Alexander I proclaims the new constitution of the Kingdom of Serbs, Croats and Slovenes, known thereafter as the Vidovdan Constitution.
Events.html: Serbian King Alexander I proclaims the new constitution of the Kingdom of Serbs, Croats and Slovenes, known thereafter as the Vidovdan Constitution.

links.title: Kingdom of Serbs, Croats and Slovenes

Events.text: The Irish Civil War begins with the shelling of the Four Courts in Dublin by Free State forces.
Events.html: The Irish Civil War begins with the shelling of the Four Courts in Dublin by Free State forces.

Events.text: Mercedes-Benz is formed by Gottlieb Daimler and Karl Benz merging their two companies.
Events.html: Mercedes-Benz is formed by Gottlieb Daimler and Karl Benz merging their two companies.

Events.text: The Japanese puppet state of Mengjiang is formed in northern China.
Events.html: The Japanese puppet state of Mengjiang is formed in northern China.

Events.text: Romania cedes Bessarabia (current-day Moldova) to the Soviet Union after facing an ultimatum.
Events.html: Romania cedes Bessarabia (current-day Moldova) to the Soviet Union after facing an ultimatum.

links.title: Soviet occupation of Bessarabia and Northern Bukovina

Events.text: World War II: Nazi Germany starts its strategic summer offensive against the Soviet Union, codenamed Case Blue
Events.html: World War II: Nazi Germany starts its strategic summer offensive against the Soviet Union, codenamed Case Blue

Events.text: Poland's Soviet-allied Provisional Government of National Unity is formed over a month after V-E Day.
Events.html: Poland's Soviet-allied Provisional Government of National Unity is formed over a month after V-E Day.

Events.text: The Tito–Stalin Split results in the expulsion of the League of Communists of Yugoslavia from the Cominform.
Events.html: The Tito–Stalin Split results in the expulsion of the League of Communists of Yugoslavia from the Cominform.

Events.text: Boxer Dick Turpin beats Vince Hawkins at Villa Park in Birmingham to become the first black British boxing champion in the modern era.
Events.html: 1948 – Boxer Dick Turpin beats Vince Hawkins at Villa Park in Birmingham to become the first black British boxing champion in the modern era.

Events.text: Korean War: Seoul is captured by North Korean troops.
Events.html: Korean War: Seoul is captured by North Korean troops.

Events.text: Korean War: Suspected communist sympathizers, believed to be between 100,000 and 200,000 are executed in the Bodo League massacre.
Events.html: 1950 – Korean War: Suspected communist sympathizers, believed to be between 100,000 and 200,000 are executed in the Bodo League massacre.

Events.text: Korean War: Packed with its own refugees fleeing Seoul and leaving their 5th Division stranded, South Korean forces blow up the Hangang Bridge to in attempt to slow North Korea's offensive.
Events.html: 1950 – Korean War: Packed with its own refugees fleeing Seoul and leaving their 5th Division stranded, South Korean forces blow up the Hangang Bridge to in attempt to slow North Korea's offensive.

Events.text: Korean War: North Korean Army conducts Seoul National University Hospital massacre.
Events.html: 1950 – Korean War: North Korean Army conducts Seoul National University Hospital massacre.

Events.text: in Poznań, workers from HCP factory go to the streets, sparking one of the first major protests against communist government both in Poland and Europe.
Events.html: in Poznań, workers from HCP factory go to the streets, sparking one of the first major protests against communist government both in Poland and Europe.

Events.text: Malcolm X forms the Organization of Afro-American Unity.
Events.html: Malcolm X forms the Organization of Afro-American Unity.

Events.text: Stonewall riots begin in New York City, marking the start of the Gay Rights Movement.
Events.html: Stonewall riots begin in New York City, marking the start of the Gay Rights Movement.

Events.text: Elections are held for the Northern Ireland Assembly, which will lead to power-sharing between unionists and nationalists in Northern Ireland for the first time.
Events.html: Elections are held for the Northern Ireland Assembly, which will lead to power-sharing between unionists and nationalists in Northern Ireland for the first time.

Events.text: The Angolan court sentences US and UK mercenaries to death sentences and prison terms in the Luanda Trial.
Events.html: The Angolan court sentences US and UK mercenaries to death sentences and prison terms in the Luanda Trial.

Events.text: The United States Supreme Court, in Regents of the University of California v. Bakke bars quota systems in college admissions.
Events.html: The United States Supreme Court, in Regents of the University of California v. Bakke bars quota systems in college admissions.

links.title: Supreme Court of the United States
Regents of the University of California v. Bakke

Events.text: A powerful bomb explodes in Tehran, killing 73 officials of the Islamic Republican Party.
Events.html: A powerful bomb explodes in Tehran, killing 73 officials of the Islamic Republican Party.

Events.text: For the first time in military history, a civilian population is targeted for chemical attack when Iraqi warplanes bombed the Iranian town of Sardasht.
Events.html: For the first time in military history, a civilian population is targeted for chemical attack when Iraqi warplanes bombed the Iranian town of Sardasht.

Events.text: On the 600th anniversary of the Battle of Kosovo, Slobodan Milošević delivers the Gazimestan speech at the site of the historic battle.
Events.html: On the 600th anniversary of the Battle of Kosovo, Slobodan Milošević delivers the Gazimestan speech at the site of the historic battle.

Events.text: The Constitution of Estonia is signed into law.
Events.html: The Constitution of Estonia is signed into law.

Events.text: Members of the Aum Shinrikyo cult release sarin gas in Matsumoto, Japan; Seven people are killed, 660 injured.
Events.html: Members of the Aum Shinrikyo cult release sarin gas in Matsumoto, Japan; Seven people are killed, 660 injured.

Events.text: The Constitution of Ukraine is signed into law.
Events.html: The Constitution of Ukraine is signed into law.

Events.text: Holyfield–Tyson II: Mike Tyson is disqualified in the third round for biting a piece off Evander Holyfield's ear.
Events.html: Holyfield–Tyson II: Mike Tyson is disqualified in the third round for biting a piece off Evander Holyfield's ear.

Events.text: Slobodan Milošević is extradited to the ICTY in The Hague to stand trial.
Events.html: Slobodan Milošević is extradited to the ICTY in The Hague to stand trial.

Events.text: Sovereign power is handed to the interim government of Iraq by the Coalition Provisional Authority, ending the U.S.-led rule of that nation.
Events.html: Sovereign power is handed to the interim government of Iraq by the Coalition Provisional Authority, ending the U.S.-led rule of that nation.

Events.text: Honduran president Manuel Zelaya is ousted by a local military coup following a failed request to hold a referendum to rewrite the Honduran Constitution. This was the start of the 2009 Honduran constitutional crisis.
Events.html: Honduran president Manuel Zelaya is ousted by a local military coup following a failed request to hold a referendum to rewrite the Honduran Constitution. This was the start of the 2009 Honduran constitutional crisis.

Events.text: A terrorist attack in Turkey's Istanbul Atatürk Airport kills 42 people and injures more than 230 others.
Events.html: A terrorist attack in Turkey's Istanbul Atatürk Airport kills 42 people and injures more than 230 others.
